Properties of all dependencies

Highlighted Properties

Project Property Key Default Value Description
kernel-service kernel.flushBeforeQuery true Enables/disables automatic flush invocation before query (true/false)
kernel-persistence kernel.autoInitMode create Defines how system should be initialized
Possible values:
- ignore : (recommended) No check during startup. Use init-app to initialize/update system
- create : Will initialize system if not initialized or fail when not up to date.
- update : Will initialize system if not initialized or update when not up to date.
- create-drop : Will drop schema (and ALL DATA) and then initialize system from scratch again.
hybris-commons-tenant kernel.defaultTenant single Name of tenant which will be used as the 'single' tenant
in case kernel.singleTenantMode=true, otherwise property has no effect
hybris-commons-tenant kernel.singleTenantMode true Enables/Disables single tenant context, so always the
tenant configured by kernel.defaultTenant is active in context
kernel-cache kernel.cacheEnabled true Enables/Disables kernel cache (true/false)
kernel-cache kernel.distributedCache false Enables/Disables distributed cache (true/false)
jdbc-engine dataSource.className org.hsqldb.jdbc.JDBCDataSource Fully qualified name of the JDBC data source class used by the driver of the database
jdbc-engine dataSource.jdbcUrl jdbc:hsqldb:mem:testDB JDBC connection URL
jdbc-engine dataSource.username sa Username to use for connection
jdbc-engine dataSource.password Password to use for connection
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.url mongodb://localhost:27017 MongoDB connection URL
See: http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/connection-string/
Replica Set seed servers URL example: mongodb://localhost:27017,localhost:27018,localhost:27019
Authentication enabled server URL example: mongodb://user:password@localhost:27017/dbName?authMechanism=MONGODB-CR
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.databaseName _CHANGE_ME_ Database name
init-app kernel.initapp.enabled true Defines application name used to register Init App REST resource in service registry
initapp.application.name=
Enables/disables InitApp
init-app kernel.initapp.securityKey If set to non-empty value enables security
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.gateway.uri http://myHost:myPort/gateway-servlet/gateway Base URI of the gateway, usually something like http://myHost:myPort/gateway-servlet/gateway
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.rest.client.httpclient.readTimeout 5000 Connect timeout interval in milliseconds.
A value of 0 is equivalent to an interval of infinity.
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.rest.client.logging.enabled false Enables the logging of each request/response done by the rest client.
It will log url, headers and message body
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.current.service myService Tells the rest client as which service the client should act.
Used only in external endpoint scenario with usage of gateway.
The rest client will use the current service configuration to build the request URL,
the gateway will extract it from the URL and will use it to lookup the related subscription configuration.
Possible values are all service id's having a service descriptor
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.security.api.authentication.enable false Enables/Disables security for rest calls.
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.security.http.basic.auth.enable false Enables/Disables basic authentication for rest calls.
hybris-commons-security hybris.security.keystore.path /hybris/gateway.jks Absolute path to key store file which is storing api keys
for request authentication
hybris-commons-security hybris.security.keystore.password 123456 Password for key store in clear text

All Properties

Project Property Key Default Value Description
entitlements-service entitlement.update.attempts 5 Max number of attempts for concurrent update
entitlements-service entitlement.update.offset 30 Max delay between the attempts, ms
The delay is intended to spare concurrent requests in time
and varies randomly from 0 to the offset.
entitlements-service kernel.applicationArtifactId com.hybris.entitlements
entitlements-service kernel.applicationGroupId entitlements
entitlements-service kernel.applicationVersion 5.6.0.0

hybris-commons-configuration commons.configuration.applicationArtifactId ${kernel.applicationArtifactId}
hybris-commons-configuration commons.configuration.applicationVersion ${kernel.applicationVersion}
kernel-service kernel.flushBeforeQuery true Enables/disables automatic flush invocation before query (true/false)
kernel-service kernel.metadata.query.cache.enabled false enable/disable the query cache for metadata service
kernel-service kernel.metadata.query.cache.ttl 0 default time to live for query cache in msec
kernel-service kernel.sequence.provider jdbcPersistenceEngine Name of bean which provides default SequenceService implementation
kernel-service kernel.sequence.cacheSize 500 Size of sequence cached numbers
kernel-service kernel.sequence.maxAttempts 10 Number of attempts to get new number from sequence
kernel-service kernel.transaction.counterSize 5000 Transaction number counter fixed size
kernel-persistence initialization.validateUniqueSupported true Enables/Disables validation if managed objects with unique attributes
or indexes are associated with persistence engine which supports uniqueness
(true/false)
kernel-persistence initialization.validateGeoSupported true Enables/Disables validation if managed objects with geospatial indexes are associated
with persistence engine which supports geospatial
(true/false)
kernel-persistence kernel.autoInitMode create Defines how system should be initialized
Possible values:
- ignore : (recommended) No check during startup. Use init-app to initialize/update system
- create : Will initialize system if not initialized or fail when not up to date.
- update : Will initialize system if not initialized or update when not up to date.
- create-drop : Will drop schema (and ALL DATA) and then initialize system from scratch again.
kernel-persistence kernel.projectDataPath /META-INF/project-data-* Regular expression path to project data. Separate different paths by ','
kernel-persistence kernel.essentialDataPath /META-INF/essential-data-*,/META-INF/initial-data-* Regular expression path to essential data. Separate different paths by ','
kernel-persistence kernel.taskExecutor.maxPoolSize 4 Maximum pool size of task executor
kernel-persistence kernel.taskExecutor.corePoolSize 4 Initial pool size of task executor
kernel-persistence kernel.eventProcessingTimeout 30000 Maximum time in milliseconds for kernel event listener to process the message.
After this time processing is canceled and exception is logged.
kernel-persistence kernel.importCacheSyncMode AFTER_IMPORT_CHUNK Cache synchronization mode during initial data import
Possible values: AFTER_IMPORT_CHUNK, AFTER_IMPORT, NONE - see ImportCacheSynchMode enum
kernel-persistence kernel.clearCacheAfterDeletingTenant true Enables/Disables clearing cache after deleting tenant (true/false)
kernel-persistence kernel.importBatchSize 1000 Batch size during importing initial data
kernel-persistence csv.emptyStringDefault.active false csv serialization and deserialization by default doesn't work with empty strings(instead, null values will be used).
if csv.emptyStringDefault.active is true, then csv.emptyString value will represent the empty string.
kernel-persistence csv.emptyString Value which represents empty string
kernel-persistence csv.locales de,fr,en,pl,it,zh,ja Supported locale during import and export
kernel-persistence kernel.events.cluster.jgroups.channel jgroups-protocol.xml JGroups channel configuration
Possible values:
disable, skip - skips configuration
enable, default - default configuration
- see jgroups documentation
kernel-persistence kernel.jgroups.udp.mcast_addr 224.0.0.252
kernel-persistence kernel.jgroups.udp.mcast_port 45588
kernel-persistence kernel.tenantNameRegexPattern [a-zA-Z_0-9]{1,10} Pattern used to validate names of tenants during tenant creation process.
If this pattern is empty no validation will be done.
kernel-persistence kernel.propertyMetadataReader.fileNamePattern /META-INF/schemaless-metadata.properties Pattern use to scan for files with metadata information for schema-less attributes
kernel-persistence kernel.import.incremental false default stream import settings
hybris-commons-tenant kernel.defaultTenant single Name of tenant which will be used as the 'single' tenant
in case kernel.singleTenantMode=true, otherwise property has no effect
hybris-commons-tenant kernel.singleTenantMode true Enables/Disables single tenant context, so always the
tenant configured by kernel.defaultTenant is active in context
kernel-cache kernel.cacheEnabled true Enables/Disables kernel cache (true/false)
kernel-cache kernel.distributedCache false Enables/Disables distributed cache (true/false)
kernel-cache kernel.ehcache.peerProviderFactoryClass net.sf.ehcache.distribution.jgroups.JGroupsCacheManagerPeerProviderFactory EHCache configuration, see: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
kernel.ehcache.peerProviderFactoryClass=net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMICacheManagerPeerProviderFactory
kernel-cache kernel.ehcache.peerProviderFactoryProperties peerDiscovery=automatic,\
multicastGroupAddress=230.0.0.1,\
multicastGroupPort=4446,\
timeToLive=16		 EHCache configuration, see: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
kernel-cache timeToLive 16
kernel-cache kernel.ehcache.peerListenerFactoryClass EHCache configuration. See: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
kernel.ehcache.peerListenerFactoryClass=net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMICacheManagerPeerListenerFactory
kernel-cache kernel.ehcache.peerListenerFactoryProperties port=40001,socketTimeoutMillis=500 EHCache configuration, see: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
kernel-cache kernel.ehcache.cacheReplicatorFactoryClass net.sf.ehcache.distribution.jgroups.JGroupsCacheReplicatorFactory EHCache configuration, see: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
kernel.ehcache.cacheReplicatorFactoryClass=net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMICacheReplicatorFactory
with ehcache-core 2.6.2
kernel-cache kernel.ehcache.cacheReplicatorFactoryProperties replicateAsynchronously=true,\
replicatePuts=true,\
replicateUpdates=true,\
replicateUpdatesViaCopy=true,\
replicateRemovals=true		 EHCache configuration, see: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
kernel-cache replicateRemovals true
kernel-cache kernel.ehcache.destroyManagerWhenContextDie true EHCache configuration, see: http://www.ehcache.org/documentation/user-guide/rmi-replicated-caching
kernel-cache entityCacheRegion.size 50000 Cache region configuration
by default we have two regions queryCacheRegion and entityCacheRegion
kernel-cache entityCacheRegion.evictionPolicy LRU
kernel-cache entityCacheRegion.stats.enabled true
kernel-cache entityCacheRegion.exclusiveComputation false
kernel-cache entityCacheRegion.ttlSeconds ttlSeconds - default ttl for entity cache records in the cache. If not set no TTL is set by default (entries are eternal)
kernel-cache queryCacheRegion.size 20000
kernel-cache queryCacheRegion.evictionPolicy LRU
kernel-cache queryCacheRegion.stats.enabled true
kernel-cache queryCacheRegion.exclusiveComputation false
kernel-cache queryCacheRegion.ttlSeconds ttlSeconds - default ttl for query cache records in the cache. If not set no TTL is set by default (entries are eternal)
kernel-cache kernel.queryCache.createMD5 true Default property to generate key with MD5
kernel-cache regioncache.exclusivecomputation true Test properties only
we do not have default-test.properties file pattern so they have to be here
kernel-cache regioncache.stats.enabled true
kernel-cache regioncache.entityregion.size 10000
kernel-cache regioncache.entityregion.evictionpolicy FIFO
kernel-cache regioncache.typesystemregion.size 10000
kernel-cache regioncache.typesystemregion.evictionpolicy FIFO
kernel-cache regioncache.querycacheregion.size 10000
kernel-cache regioncache.querycacheregion.evictionpolicy FIFO
kernel-cache kernel.cache.liveDataCounterName cacheDistributedCounter live data name for distributed counter
kernel-cache kernel.cache.generationalCacheEnabled false Enables generational cache for queries. It introduces overhead because each managed
object modification has to be propagated to all cluster nodes
hybris-commons-monitoring hybris.commons.jmx.registrationBehaviorName FAIL_ON_EXISTING JMX Bean registration strategy. Possible values:
FAIL_ON_EXISTING
IGNORE_EXISTING
REPLACE_EXISTING
hybris-commons-monitoring hybris.commons.jmx.useAppVersionProvider true Enables/disables use of AppVersionProvider to create domain name for JMX MBeans
hybris-commons-monitoring hybris.commons.jmx.defaultDomain com.hybris Default name of JMX domain for beans exposed by commons jmx module
hybris-commons-monitoring hybris.commons.jmx.systemPropertiesMBean.name System Properties Name of System Properties MBean
hybris-commons-monitoring hybris.commons.collect.jvm.metric true Expose CollectJvmMetrics
jdbc-engine dataSource.className org.hsqldb.jdbc.JDBCDataSource Fully qualified name of the JDBC data source class used by the driver of the database
jdbc-engine dataSource.jdbcUrl jdbc:hsqldb:mem:testDB JDBC connection URL
jdbc-engine dataSource.username sa Username to use for connection
jdbc-engine dataSource.password Password to use for connection
jdbc-engine dataSource.jndiName JNDI name of data source
jdbc-engine dataSource.maxConnections 36 Maximum number of connections that will be contained in every partition
jdbc-engine dataSource.minConnections 16 Minimum number of connections that will be contained in every partition
jdbc-engine dataSource.connectionTimeoutInMs 5000 Sets the maximum time (in milliseconds) to wait before a call to getConnection is timed out.
Setting this to zero is similar to setting it to Long.MAX_VALUE Default: 0 ( = wait forever )
jdbc-engine dataSource.defaultAutoCommit true Sets default auto commit mode
jdbc-engine dataSource.idleConnectionTestPeriodInSeconds 14400 This sets the time (in seconds), for a connection to remain idle before sending
a test query to the DB. This is useful to prevent a DB from timing out connections
on its end. Do not use aggressive values here!
jdbc-engine dataSource.idleMaxAgeInSeconds 3600 The time (in seconds), for a connection to remain unused before it is closed off. Do not use aggressive values here!
Default: 60 minutes, set to 0 to disable.
jdbc-engine dataSource.statementsCacheSize 0 Sets statementsCacheSize setting.
The number of statements to cache.
jdbc-engine dataSource.releaseHelperThreads 3 Useful when your application is doing lots of work on each connection
(i.e. perform an SQL query, do lots of non-DB stuff and perform another query),
otherwise will probably slow things down.
jdbc-engine dataSource.statementReleaseHelperThreads 0 Sets number of statement helper threads to create that will handle releasing a statement.
When this value is set to zero, the application thread is blocked until the pool and JDBC driver are able to close off the statement.
When a non-zero value is set, the pool will create threads that will take care of closing off the statement asychronously to the application via the release helper
threads).
Useful when your application is opening up lots of statements otherwise will probably slow things down.
jdbc-engine dataSource.acquireIncrement 5 When the available connections are about to run out, BoneCP will dynamically create new ones in batches.
This property controls how many new connections to create in one go (up to a maximum of maxConnectionsPerPartition).
Note: This is a per partition setting.
jdbc-engine dataSource.partitionCount 3 In order to reduce lock contention and thus improve performance,
each incoming connection request picks off a connection from a pool that has thread-affinity,
i.e. pool[threadId % partition_count]. The higher this number, the better your performance will be for the case
when you have plenty of short-lived threads. Beyond a certain threshold, maintenance of these pools will start
to have a negative effect on performance (and only for the case when connections on a partition start running out).
jdbc-engine connectionPool.name kernel Name used for the connection pool used by kernel.
This name is handed to the underlying Hikari connection pool and used for logging and JMX export
jdbc-engine connectionPool.registerMbeans true Enables the Export of MBeans for the HikariCP this is required for JMX monitoring.
jdbc-engine kernel.jdbc.batch.disabled false Enables/disables collecting update statements and params which are then executed in a batch statement during update (true/false)
jdbc-engine kernel.jdbc.batch.oracle.batchSize 50 Number of batched updates to accumulate before real execution (Oracle database only)
jdbc-engine kernel.jdbc.fetchSize 0 Number of rows that should be fetched (0 means default driver properties)
jdbc-engine kernel.jdbc.maxRows 0 Maximum number of rows that will be fetched (0 means there is no limit)
jdbc-engine kernel.jdbc.schemaName Optional. Schema name used to create objects. If left empty kernel will try to determine database schema automatically.
If set to "null" no schema will be provided to the queries.
jdbc-engine kernel.jdbc.schemalessAttributeType VARCHAR:255 type:size of shemalesss attribute value column. Use any type from java.sql.Types
jdbc-engine kernel.jdbc.platform.delimitedIdentifierMode AUTO delimitedIdentifierMode: overrides the default behaviour of platform-specific delimited identifier mode (e.g. double quotes around db entities)
could accept values AUTO, true and false
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.url mongodb://localhost:27017 MongoDB connection URL
See: http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/connection-string/
Replica Set seed servers URL example: mongodb://localhost:27017,localhost:27018,localhost:27019
Authentication enabled server URL example: mongodb://user:password@localhost:27017/dbName?authMechanism=MONGODB-CR
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.databaseName _CHANGE_ME_ Database name
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.autoConnectRetry false Mongo options see http://http://api.mongodb.org/java/current/com/mongodb/MongoOptions.html
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.connectionsPerHost 10
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.connectTimeout 5000
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.description MongoDBConnection
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.maxAutoConnectRetryTime 0
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.maxWaitTime 120000
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.safe false
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.socketKeepAlive false
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.socketTimeout 5000
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.schemalessMetadataCollectionName schemaless_metadata
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.retry.count 7
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.retry.wait 1000
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.writeConcern NORMAL
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.alwaysUseMBeans false
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.threadsAllowedToBlockForConnectionMultiplier 5
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.cursorFinalizerEnabled true
mongodb-engine persistence.engine.mongodb.option.readPreference primaryPreferred
kernel-type-system kernel.typesystem.extensions [y] hybris Platform
Copyright (c) 2000-2015 hybris AG
All rights reserved.
This software is the confidential and proprietary information of hybris
("Confidential Information"). You shall not disclose such Confidential
Information and shall use it only in accordance with the terms of the
license agreement you entered into with hybris.
the parameter, if not empty, filters the extensions to consider
init-app kernel.initapp.enabled true Defines application name used to register Init App REST resource in service registry
initapp.application.name=
Enables/disables InitApp
init-app kernel.initapp.systemInitializationEnabled true Enables/disables system initialization option in Init-App
init-app kernel.initapp.securityKey If set to non-empty value enables security
init-app kernel.initapp.taskExecutor.poolSize 1 Thread pool size for asynchronous operations
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.gateway.uri http://myHost:myPort/gateway-servlet/gateway Base URI of the gateway, usually something like http://myHost:myPort/gateway-servlet/gateway
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.rest.client.alternative true Sets whether an alternative endpointProvider then the ExternalEndpointProvider (gateway) should be used.
For being able to use this property you must configure the AlternativeEndpointProviderFactory in your spring setup.
It is recommended to use it only if you will use the gateway on production but wants to avoid the gateway usage in developent!
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.rest.client.proxy auto Allow to use a proxy setup for the rest client.
Possible values:
* 'auto' (default) proxy settings will be discovered based on system properties (http.proxyHost, http.proxyPort ...)
* 'none' - no proxy will be set
* a specific uri - this proxy will be used explicitly. example http://www.proxy.com:3128
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.rest.client.httpclient.readTimeout 5000 Connect timeout interval in milliseconds.
A value of 0 is equivalent to an interval of infinity.
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.rest.client.httpclient.connectionManager.maxConnectionsPerHost 20 Sets the maximum number of connections allowed for the rest client.
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.rest.client.httpclient.connectionManager.maxTotalConnections 60 The maximum number of connections allowed.
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.rest.client.httpclient.connectionManager.timeout 5000 The timeout in milliseconds used when retrieving an
HTTP connection from the HTTP connection manager.
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.rest.client.logging.enabled false Enables the logging of each request/response done by the rest client.
It will log url, headers and message body
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.current.service myService Tells the rest client as which service the client should act.
Used only in external endpoint scenario with usage of gateway.
The rest client will use the current service configuration to build the request URL,
the gateway will extract it from the URL and will use it to lookup the related subscription configuration.
Possible values are all service id's having a service descriptor
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.security.api.authentication.enable false Enables/Disables security for rest calls.
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.security.http.basic.auth.enable false Enables/Disables basic authentication for rest calls.
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.security.http.basic.auth.username The basic authentication username
hybris-commons-rest-client hybris.security.http.basic.auth.password The basic authentication password
hybris-commons-security hybris.security.apiKeyProvider defaultApiKeyProvider Implementation to use for apikeyprovider.
Must be a spring bean name implementing ApiKeyProvider interface
hybris-commons-security hybris.security.keystore.path /hybris/gateway.jks Absolute path to key store file which is storing api keys
for request authentication
hybris-commons-security hybris.security.keystore.password 123456 Password for key store in clear text
hybris-commons-security hybris.security.keystoreservice.loadIntervalInMs 1000 Defines the loading interval of key store file.
For each get key request it will load keys from key store file
only if last time file initialization is longer then given
interval.
hybris-commons-security hybris.security.fileLock.lockTimeOutInMs 10000 Time out on the wait if key store file is locked.
Based on given value in milli seconds it will try out to lock
the key store file in given timeout.
hybris-commons-security hybris.security.fileLock.waitInMs 100 Wait time in milli seconds till next try to lock the key store file.
